intro: Halicacabus willisii, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves and a deep root system, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to high temperatures and low precipitation. Halicacabus willisii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
